title.narrative: Support For Improving Living Environment And Disaster Prevention Capacity In Cambodia

description.narrative: This project is formulated in line with the Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) between General Department of Housing of Ministry of Land Management, Urban Planning and Construction and UN-Habitat in Cambodia which envisages the promotion of resilience housing in the country and enhance the capacity of the housing sector. Accordingly, the project was formulated in responding to the urgent needs of supporting flood affected most vulnerable families living in Tbong Khmom province. In the first instant the project contributes to the government’s efforts on supporting reconstruction process of the effected communities due to natural hazards, As UN-Habitat has been recognized with its previous experience in supporting disaster effected families and building housing sector capacity in Cambodia. Government of Japan through its supplementary budget (humanitarian finding window) agreed to support the affected communities in partnership with UN-Habitat which was endorsed by the focal ministry. The project actions also contribute to the implementation of the UNDAF, aligns with national and sub-national development policies, strategies and plans on development, climate change and disaster resilience.The Project will contribute to fill the capacity gaps in disaster resilient planning specially at commune level which is clearly aligned with the government’s efforts on implementing Decentralization and Deconcentration policy which promotes local capacity building.The project aims toachieve recovery and strengthened resilience of the 2018 flood affected population by ensuring access to sage and resilient shelter to people in displacement areas and/or to households with destroyed shelter, including disaster preparedness measures (short-term goal);increase knowledge of communities throughout the country on production and use of low cost, local, environmentally friendly and durable building materials, resilient housing concepts and disaster and climate change ‘safe’ land use options (medium-term goal).

department.narrative: Regional Office for Asia and the Pacific

mailing-address.narrative: UN-HABITAT P.O. Box 30030 GPO Nairobi 00100 Kenya

title.narrative: 1. National and subnational government officers' capacity on resilient housing are developed and disaster risk reduction elements are integrated into local urban planning

title.narrative: Completed assessment and action planning of target settlements (as proxy-indicator for capacities)

description.narrative: Completed assessment and action planning of target settlements (as proxy-indicator for capacities)

baseline.value: Data collected NCDM provides baseline of destruction and needs at provincial level and no community-level action plans.

target.value: Comprehensive recovery plans concretely addressing the needs of the most vulnerable (including women and youth) have been developed.

title.narrative: 2. Flood-affected communities develop capacity on resilient construction methods, improved living conditions and livelihood

description.narrative: 2. Flood-affected communities develop capacity on resilient construction methods, improved living conditions and livelihood

title.narrative: Community action plans implemented (as proxy indicator for community resilience and well-being)

description.narrative: Community action plans implemented (as proxy indicator for community resilience and well-being)

baseline.value: Resilience and living conditions of affected communities in general and its most vulnerable members has significantly improved

target.value: Living conditions of increased of 200 households in affected communities (average of 51.22 % women)
